description: The sumptuous top wine from this estate, this is produced in tiny quantities. It is gorgeously ripe, with dried fruits, crystallized orange and supersmooth honey. Botrytis gives the dry edge to the wine that will let it age for so much time. Drink from 2025.
title: Château Lapinesse 2016 Grand Vin  (Sauternes)

description: This richly structured and tannic wine offers dark fruit and ripe tannins. The second wine of Château Palmer, it's full of black-plum and dense berry flavors balanced by the acidity and the structure. Age this wine and drink from 2023.
title: Château Palmer 2016 Alter Ego de Château Palmer  (Margaux)

description: Now with more Cabernet Sauvignon in the blend than in the past, this wine has elegant black-currant fruits and tannins allied to a lift of acidity. Showing the continued improvements at this southern Margaux estate, the wine is joyful and ripe. Drink from 2025.
title: Château Siran 2016  Margaux

description: A blend of 62% Cabernet Sauvignon, 18% Merlot, 18% Cabernet Franc and 2% Petit Verdot, this fragrant red opens with enticing scents of black-skinned berry, bell pepper, graphite and pipe tobacco. The concentrated but elegantly structured palate delivers layers of black currant jam, ripe plum, star anise and a touch of mocha alongside firm, fine-grained tannins. Drink 2020–2030.
title: Guado al Tasso 2015  Bolgheri Superiore

description: Fermented in new oak but aged in neutral, this single-vineyard expression from Dusty Road Vineyard offers aromas of honeysuckle, chalk and squeezed tangerine on the delicate and fresh nose. There is tons of grip to the sip, where exuberant citrus and stone-fruit flavors are bright and carried by racy acidity.
title: Hubba 2016 Carciofi Chardonnay (Santa Cruz County)

description: This expertly blends 67% Syrah with 33% Grenache into a blockbuster package of full-bodied flavor and balanced brightness, melding together sanguine meaty tones with an underlying richness of blueberry pie and graham cracker. Velvety smooth, it packs a memorably delicious punch.
title: Jeff Cohn 2016 #Pure Yum Syrah-Grenache (Sonoma County)

description: Ripe black-skinned fruit, dark culinary-spice, pipe tobacco, leather and menthol aromas come together in the glass. Round, juicy and savory, the plush palate delivers succulent black cherry, spiced blueberry and blackberry compote alongside star anise and ground pepper notes. Velvety tannins provide supple, seamless support.
title: Le Macchiole 2016 Rosso  (Bolgheri)

description: Ethereally elegant and fragrant, this offers enticing scents of rose petal, wild strawberry, aromatic herb and a whiff of freshly tilled earth. The radiant palate boasts tension and finesse, offering red cherry, pomegranate, star anise and white pepper framed in taut polished tannins and vibrant acidity. It's linear and racy, but also balanced. Drink 2020–2029.
title: Le Potazzine 2014  Brunello di Montalcino

description: Aromas of dark berry, cedar and eucalyptus lead the way on this elegant blend of Merlot, Syrah, Cabernet Sauvignon, Merlot, Sangiovese and Syrah. The balanced, creamy palate offers dried black cherry, black-currant jam, mocha and tobacco alongside fine-grained tannins. The savory flavors linger on the long finish. Enjoy through 2030.
title: Michele Satta 2015 Piastraia  (Bolgheri Superiore)

description: Better known for its Ports, this stunning upper Douro quinta also makes small amounts of still wine. This wine is every bit as fine in its way as the Ports, rich in structure, tannins and ripe fruits. The wine's fruitiness is still so young, and it will age well. Drink this very fine wine from 2023.
title: Quinta do Vesuvio 2016 Red (Douro)

description: Strong aromas of black cherry paste and clove are made more elegant with smashed wet slate minerality on the nose of this wine. The palate is complex, with big and bright red fruits, white pepper and tarragon playing off of the earthy structure.
title: Siduri 2017 La Encantada Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)

description: Pipe tobacco, new leather, underbrush, spiced plum and violet are just some of the aromas you'll find on this fragrant red. The taut racy palate delivers ripe Morello cherry, licorice, espresso, ground pepper and a hint of blood orange while tightly knit, rather dusty tannins and firm acidity provide the framework. Drink 2022–2033.
title: Terralsole 2013 Riserva  (Brunello di Montalcino)

description: This blend of fruit from Bien Nacido and Presqu'ile vineyards starts with aromas of pomegranate, mulberry, tangy plum and Earl Grey tea on the nose. More tea, dried mint and tarragon lift the palate through the background of richer red-plum and rose-petals flavors, all proving very delicate yet complex.
title: Timbre 2015 Supergroup Pinot Noir (Santa Maria Valley)

description: This is a juicy full-bodied white that is well balanced by crisp apple and orange flavors. Integrated tones of nutmeg and ginger offer support, while a lasting note of wet stone underlines a mineral component.
title: Williams Selyem 2017 Heintz Vineyard Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: This is a fresh, vibrant and all-around high-toned white from the heart of the Olivet Lane District. It is full in weight and concentrated in welcoming teases of citrus pith, lemongrass and ginger.
title: Williams Selyem 2017 Olivet Lane Vineyard Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: Made with dried Sangiovese grapes, this opens with aromas evoking candied orange zest, caramel, maple syrup and dried date. The smooth, concentrated palate offers black cherry jam, eucalyptus honey and toasted hazelnut that carry on to the long finish.
title: Avignonesi 2002 Occhio di Pernice  (Vin Santo di Montepulciano)

description: Silky smooth, highly integrated aromas of baked black fruits and fine cocoa are just the beginning of the road on this superb gran reserva with a funky label. Concentrated and fully charged on the palate, this deals rowdy but delicious plum and berry flavors backed by wood spice and cinnamon. A stout finish keeps up with the fruit. Drink or hold for years to come (through 2035).
title: Casa Primicia 2012 Viña Diezmo GR Gran Reserva  (Rioja)

description: The top wine from this grand estate is made from selected rows of old vines. It has both deep flavor and intense concentration, offering ripe white fruits that are now mature as well as a nutty character that balances the rich texture. The wine is sure to age well. Drink from 2021.
title: Château de Tracy 2015 101 Rangs  (Pouilly-Fumé)

description: With its dense texture and high proportion of Cabernet Sauvignon in the blend, this is an impressively powerful second wine of Château Margaux. Acidity and dark blueberry flavors are concentrated, with layers of tannins that demand aging. Drink from 2023.
title: Château Margaux 2016 Pavillon Rouge du Château Margaux  (Margaux)

description: Blended with 5% each of Merlot and Malbec, this is an impressive, full-bodied red that displays a clove and cinnamon entry. Blackberry and black currant flavors are seamless on the palate, while a high-toned acidity comes to life on the red-fruit-driven finish.
title: Flambeaux 2015 Cabernet Sauvignon (Sonoma Valley)
